entry.title: Spring CTC Tea
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Teas India
Type: Black Tea
Price: 9.90 - 18.00 (2 variants)

Spring harvest comes after almost 3 months of plucking closure during winters in the Terai region. This tea is manufactured from the leaves plucked in the first week of flushing - the most prime time - and comes with rare & mild floral aroma and mild sweetness, characters not found anytime of the year thereafter. Drinking this delicious brew is indeed a very pleasant experience.

entry.title: Ginger Mastea - Indian Masala Chai
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Black Tea
Price: 13.99 - 22.99 (2 variants)

A classic blend of strong CTC tea with a host of selected Indian spices along with the aromatic and pungent Ginger. This traditional recipe makes for an unforgettable drink that is best served in a shot glass or clay cup.
Can also be served chilled. Best with milk.
Ingredients:
CTC Tea, Cinnamon, Green Cardamom, Cloves, Dry ginger
How to Prepare Ginger Mastea - Indian Masala Chai
  • Mix 1 portion milk & 2 portion of water. Bring to a boil.
  • Add 1 Tsp. of Ginger Mastea Tea Leaves to the boil.
  • Boil for a min. till the mix fares up thrice.
  • Add Sugar and Stir
  • Strain and Serve

entry.title: Masala Chai India's Authentic Spiced Tea - Value Pack
entry.summary:
Vendor: Golden Tips Tea Co. (P) Ltd.
Type: Chai Teas
Price: 9.99 - 23.99 (3 variants)

An age-old classic, Masala Chai, literally meaning 'Spiced Tea' is one of the most popular tea blends in the world, originating from India. This unique and ancient preparation contains a strong flavoury Black Tea blended with a variety of aromatic spices.
Can also be served chilled.Best with milk.
Health Benefits:
  • Prevent Cold and Nasal Congestion,
  • Antioxidant-rich helps prevent cell damage,
  • Clove contains compounds that help in improving the immune system.
  • Cardamom has been used as a digestive which improves circulatory and digestive systems.
  • Cinnamon has anti-inflammatory properties which help the body fight infections.
How to prepare Masala Chai
Standard preparation without milk
  • Take 1 teaspoon of Golden Tips Masala Chai in a cup.
  • Pour 200 ml of freshly boiled water over the tea leaves.
  • Steep for 3-5 minutes as the leaves unfurled fully.
  • Strain the tea leaves using a strainer
  • Add sugar or honey as a sweetener.
Standard preparation with milk
  • In a saucepan take two-third of water and one-third of milk and boil it.
  • When it reaches boiling point add 1-2 teaspoons of Golden Tips Masala Chai and keep boiling for another 2-3 minutes.
  • Add sugar as per your taste.
